comments.body: @nealwu In my previous PR, I added the line breaks to conform to the 80-char line width limit. I thought those are okay. Maybe there is some reason I didn't realize.
I see, we can set it up to conform to 80-character lines if that's what we want. I figured unwrapped lines would be good since GitHub will automatically wrap them for you at the issue width.

For example, if you go to https://github.com/tensorflow/models/issues/new and click "Preview" you can see what it looks like. Even if I maximize Chrome, GitHub will limit the width to a reasonable amount.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@2. The form below must be filled out.

**Here's why we have that policy**: TensorFlow developers respond to issues. We want to focus on work that benefits the whole community, e.g., fixing bugs and adding features. Support only helps individuals. GitHub also notifies thousands of people when issues are filed. We want them to see you communicating an interesting problem, rather than being redirected to Stack Overflow.

------------------------

comments.body: The reasoning for this is that when users see this template, they will see the unformatted markdown and not the formatted version. I wanted to make it easier for them to copy-paste this command into their terminals without the shell tags.

python -c "import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.GIT_VERSION, tf.VERSION)"

### Describe the problem

### Source code / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached. Try to provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem.

comments.body: probably want lib64, not lib.  Otherwise LGTM.
